alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 2:03AM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Mississippi, including the following counties, Hancock, Harrison and Pearl River. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 202 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gulfport, Long Beach, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Kiln, Shoreline Park, Lyman, Saucier and Pearlington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
